001package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs;
002
003import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.io.InputStream;
006import java.lang.System.Logger.Level;
007import java.net.URI;
008import java.nio.file.FileSystem;
009import java.nio.file.FileSystems;
010import java.nio.file.Path;
011import java.util.Map;
012import java.util.Properties;
013import java.util.Random;
014
015import org.jspecify.annotations.NonNull;
016import org.jspecify.annotations.Nullable;
017
018import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesEnvironment.Logger;
019
020/**
021 * A facade over various system-level singletons used for loading key-value resources.
022 * This interface provides a flexible mechanism for accessing and overriding system-level
023 * components such as environment variables, system properties, and input streams.
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * Implementations can replace default system behaviors, enabling custom retrieval of
027 * environment variables or properties, or integrating custom logging mechanisms.
028 */
029public interface KeyValuesEnvironment {
030
031        /**
032         * If the loader builder is not passed any resources this resource will be used.
033         * @return default resource is <code>classpath:/boot.properties</code>
034         */
035        default KeyValuesResource defaultResource() {
036                return KeyValuesResource.builder(URI.create("classpath:/boot.properties")).build();
037        }
038
039        /**
040         * Retrieves the main method arguments. By default, returns an empty array.
041         * @return an array of main method arguments
042         */
043        default @NonNull String[] getMainArgs() {
044                return new @NonNull String[] {};
045        }
046
047        /**
048         * Retrieves the current system properties. By default, delegates to
049         * {@link System#getProperties()}.
050         * @return the current system properties
051         */
052        default Properties getSystemProperties() {
053                return System.getProperties();
054        }
055
056        /**
057         * Retrieves the current environment variables. By default, delegates to
058         * {@link System#getenv()}.
059         * @return a map of environment variables
060         */
061        default Map<String, String> getSystemEnv() {
062                return System.getenv();
063        }
064
065        /**
066         * Retrieves a random number generator. By default, returns a new {@link Random}
067         * instance.
068         * @return random.
069         */
070        default Random getRandom() {
071                return new Random();
072        }
073
074        /**
075         * Retrieves the standard input stream. By default, delegates to {@link System#in}.
076         * @return the standard input stream or an empty input stream if {@code System.in} is
077         * null
078         */
079        default InputStream getStandardInput() {
080                InputStream i = System.in;
081                return i == null ? InputStream.nullInputStream() : i;
082        }
083
084        /**
085         * Retrieves the logger instance used for logging messages. By default, returns a noop
086         * logger.
087         * @return the logger instance
088         */
089        default Logger getLogger() {
090                return Logger.of();
091        }
092
093        /**
094         * Retrieves the {@link ResourceStreamLoader} used for loading resources as streams.
095         * @return the resource stream loader instance
096         */
097        default ResourceStreamLoader getResourceStreamLoader() {
098                return new ResourceStreamLoader() {
099
100                        @Override
101                        public @Nullable InputStream getResourceAsStream(String path) throws IOException {
102                                return getClassLoader().getResourceAsStream(path);
103                        }
104                };
105        }
106
107        /**
108         * Retrieves the {@link FileSystem} used for loading file resources.
109         * @return by default {@link FileSystems#getDefault()}.
110         */
111        default FileSystem getFileSystem() {
112                return FileSystems.getDefault();
113        }
114
115        /**
116         * Gets the current working directory possibly using the passed in filesystem.
117         * @return cwd or {@code null}
118         */
119        default @Nullable Path getCWD() {
120                return null;
121        }
122
123        /**
124         * Retrieves the system class loader. By default, delegates to
125         * {@link ClassLoader#getSystemClassLoader()}.
126         * @return the system class loader
127         */
128        default ClassLoader getClassLoader() {
129                return ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader();
130        }
131
132        /**
133         * Interface for loading resources as input streams.
134         */
135        public interface ResourceStreamLoader {
136
137                /**
138                 * Retrieves an input stream for the specified resource path.
139                 * @param path the path of the resource
140                 * @return the input stream for the resource, or {@code null} if not found
141                 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs
142                 */
143                public @Nullable InputStream getResourceAsStream(String path) throws IOException;
144
145                /**
146                 * Opens an input stream for the specified resource path. Throws a
147                 * {@link FileNotFoundException} if the resource is not found.
148                 * @param path the path of the resource
149                 * @return the input stream for the resource
150                 * @throws IOException if an I/O error occurs
151                 * @throws FileNotFoundException if the resource is not found
152                 */
153                default InputStream openStream(String path) throws IOException, FileNotFoundException {
154                        InputStream s = getResourceAsStream(path);
155                        if (s == null) {
156                                throw new FileNotFoundException(path);
157                        }
158                        return s;
159                }
160
161        }
162
163        /**
164         * Key Values Resource focused logging facade and event capture. Logging level
165         * condition checking is purposely not supplied as these are more like events and many
166         * implementations will replay when the actual logging sytem loads.
167         */
168        public interface Logger {
169
170                /**
171                 * Returns a logger that uses the supplied {@link java.lang.System.Logger}.
172                 * <em>Becareful using this because something downstream may need to configure the
173                 * system logger based on Ezkv config.</em>
174                 * @param logger system logger.
175                 * @return logger.
176                 */
177                public static Logger of(System.Logger logger) {
178                        return new SystemLogger(logger);
179                }
180
181                /**
182                 * By default Ezkv does no logging because logging usually needs configuration
183                 * loaded first (Ezkv in this case).
184                 * @return noop logger.
185                 */
186                public static Logger of() {
187                        return NoOpLogger.NOPLOGGER;
188                }
189
190                /**
191                 * When Key Values System is loaded.
192                 * @param system that was just created.
193                 */
194                default void init(KeyValuesSystem system) {
195                }
196
197                /**
198                 * Logs a debug-level message.
199                 * @param message the message to log
200                 */
201                public void debug(String message);
202
203                /**
204                 * Logs an info-level message.
205                 * @param message the message to log
206                 */
207                public void info(String message);
208
209                /**
210                 * Logs an warn-level message.
211                 * @param message the message to log
212                 */
213                public void warn(String message);
214
215                /**
216                 * Logs a debug message indicating that a resource is being loaded.
217                 * @param resource the resource being loaded
218                 */
219                default void load(KeyValuesResource resource) {
220                        debug(KeyValueReference.describe(new StringBuilder("Loading "), resource, true).toString());
221                }
222
223                /**
224                 * Logs an info message indicating that a resource has been successfully loaded.
225                 * @param resource the loaded resource
226                 */
227                default void loaded(KeyValuesResource resource) {
228                        info(KeyValueReference.describe(new StringBuilder("Loaded  "), resource, false).toString());
229                }
230
231                /**
232                 * Logs a debug message indicating that a resource is missing.
233                 * @param resource the resource that was not found
234                 * @param exception the exception that occurred when the resource was not found
235                 */
236                default void missing(KeyValuesResource resource, Exception exception) {
237                        debug(KeyValueReference.describe(new StringBuilder("Missing "), resource, false).toString());
238                }
239
240                /**
241                 * This signals that key values system will no longer be used to load resources
242                 * and that some other system can now take over perhaps the logging system.
243                 * @param system key value system that was closed.
244                 */
245                default void closed(KeyValuesSystem system) {
246                }
247
248                /**
249                 * This is to signal failure that the KeyValueSystem cannot recover from while
250                 * attempting to load.
251                 * @param exception unrecoverable key values exception
252                 */
253                default void fatal(Exception exception) {
254
255                }
256
257                /**
258                 * Turns a Level into a SLF4J like level String that is all upper case and same
259                 * length with right padding. {@link Level#ALL} is "<code>TRACE</code>",
260                 * {@link Level#OFF} is "<code>ERROR</code>" and {@link Level#WARNING} is
261                 * "<code>WARN</code>".
262                 * @param level system logger level.
263                 * @return upper case string of level.
264                 */
265                public static String formatLevel(Level level) {
266                        return switch (level) {
267                                case DEBUG -> /*   */ "DEBUG";
268                                case ALL -> /*     */ "TRACE";
269                                case ERROR -> /*   */ "ERROR";
270                                case INFO -> /*    */ "INFO ";
271                                case OFF -> /*     */ "ERROR";
272                                case TRACE -> /*   */ "TRACE";
273                                case WARNING -> /* */ "WARN ";
274                        };
275                }
276
277        }
278
279}
280
281enum NoOpLogger implements Logger {
282
283        NOPLOGGER;
284
285        @Override
286        public void debug(String message) {
287        }
288
289        @Override
290        public void info(String message) {
291        }
292
293        @Override
294        public void warn(String message) {
295        }
296
297        @Override
298        public void load(KeyValuesResource resource) {
299        }
300
301        @Override
302        public void loaded(KeyValuesResource resource) {
303        }
304
305        @Override
306        public void missing(KeyValuesResource resource, Exception exception) {
307        }
308
309}
310
311final class SystemLogger implements Logger {
312
313        private final System.Logger logger;
314
315        SystemLogger(java.lang.System.Logger logger) {
316                super();
317                this.logger = logger;
318        }
319
320        @Override
321        public void debug(String message) {
322                logger.log(Level.DEBUG, message);
323        }
324
325        @Override
326        public void info(String message) {
327                logger.log(Level.INFO, message);
328        }
329
330        @Override
331        public void warn(String message) {
332                logger.log(Level.WARNING, message);
333
334        }
335
336}
337
338final class DefaultKeyValuesEnvironment implements KeyValuesEnvironment {
339

348        // }
349
350}
